stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user is on the ProcureSight Site tab **WHEN**: They enter search terms and click search **THEN**: The system uses the new backend API and displays results using the ProcureSight+ Module interface

**GIVEN**: A user has performed a procurement search **WHEN**: Results are returned from the backend **THEN**: Results display using the expanded filter set with Add to Collection and Save to Requirement actions available
**GIVEN**: A user clicks on a procurement result card **WHEN**: The procurement summary loads **THEN**: All procurement data displays with links to Vendor Summary and Codes Summary available
**GIVEN**: A user clicks on a document from search results **WHEN**: The document opens **THEN**: The Native AI Chat interface is available for document interaction
**GIVEN**: A user navigates to Requirement Summary **WHEN**: They view the tabs **THEN**: The Insights tab is renamed to Research with separate Search, Bookmarks, Documents, and Best in Class tabs

stories.story_name: Implement Search Tab in Requirement Summary
stories.acceptance_criteria: **GIVEN**: A user is on the Research tab **WHEN**: They access the Search sub-tab **THEN**: The global search interface displays with recent searches and Save to Requirement functionality
**GIVEN**: A user saves procurements to requirements **WHEN**: They navigate to the Bookmarks tab **THEN**: All saved procurements display with access to procurement summaries and removal capability
**GIVEN**: A user accesses the Collections tab **WHEN**: The page loads **THEN**: The updated UX displays as per the provided mockup specifications
**GIVEN**: A user views a collection summary **WHEN**: The page loads **THEN**: Three tabs display: Bookmarks, Documents, and Insights with appropriate content in each
**GIVEN**: The ProcureSight+ Module is available **WHEN**: Users perform searches **THEN**: All requests route through the new backend integration instead of existing PS integration code
